alert.note: Alert for Hill County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 10 at 8:20AM MST until January 12 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 5 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Hill County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 3 PM MST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon today to 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Frostbite and hypothermia are possible if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
